item.title: [Ubuntu TIP] Solved: Totem Cannot Detect UPnP Media Server
item.author: shantanu@shantanugoel.com (Shantanu Goel)
item.description: First a bit of background. A UPnP media server can serve your media files (video / audio / pictures) over the network to any compatible player. Some of the most known examples of these media servers are MediaTomb, TVersity, ushare, etc. In linux, few players can play media off these servers natively, but many require a plugin / library called “coherence”. e.g. the default media players (Totem and RhythmBox) can detect and play media from media servers once you install coherence (“sudo apt-get install python-coherence”).
